recipe.name: Juniper Ascending v3

miscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water
NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

recipe.teaser: Kornøl is a Norwegian farmhouse raw ale made with BestMalz Pale Ale Malt, Juniper branches, Saaz pellet hops and Lallemand Voss Kveik yeast.
recipe.author: The Thirsty Otter
recipe.notes:
This is a raw ale - no boil.
Wort brought to 82 ºC and held for 15 minutes to pasteurize prior to cooling. 
Beer is traditionally served with low carbonation (residual CO2 from fermentation).
Original recipe at https://escarpmentlabs.com/blogs/resources/traditional-norwegian-kornol-recipe
Remove any protein and juniper oil ("head ache") from the wort before the break (what break ?).

Add Frozen Juniper berries to the fermenter after 2 days/48 hours.

yeasts.name: Voss Kveik
yeasts.description: Origin: Sigmund Gjernes (Voss, Norway). The optimal temperature range for LalBrew® Voss yeast when producing traditional styles is 35-40°C (95-104°F). Suited for Norwegian farmhouse ales, fastfermented neutral ales. Very fast fermentations are achieved within the optimal temperaturerange with full attenuation typically achieved within 2-3 days. The flavor profile is consistent across the entire temperature range: neutral with subtle fruity notes of orange and citrus. Flocculation is very high producing clear beers without filtration or use of process aids.
